abstract: As the fear of further conflict looms, Iran is in the midst of a decisive argument with itself.
lead_paragraph: TEHRAN — In the past two weeks, Iran, a country of 80 million people, has moved from the shock and grieving over Maj. Gen. Qassim Suleimani’s assassination and the fear of imminent war with the United States to the outrage over Iranian missiles mistakenly shooting down a Ukraine jetliner and killing the 176 people on board. Vigils for the passengers killed in the crash turned into massive anti-government protests in Tehran and other parts of the country.
